Wooooowwww. Now I thought I found the best Mexican places in the city but I was oh so very wrong. I went here about 6 years ago for happy hour and wasn't impressed, came back tonight for the full treatment and was left completely satisfied. 
Our bartender Kabira was super friendly, explained all of their specials and how fresh everything is. They had 4 special margaritas (pumpkin, ginger, prickly pear and pineapple/basil) I stuck with the basil ones the whole night and my boyfriend tried each of the other specials (his favorite was ginger). I could drink that pineapple basil one like it was water all day every day yum!
We started with the chorizo queso which was PHENOMENAL. 10/10 would order again. Came out super hot, perfectly meaty pull-able cheese. We struggled for a bit whether or not we were going to grab dinner from here or just stick with the app and drinks. So glad we stayed because it gave me a chance to try the ever so popular birra tacos and him to try all the different special margs. I ordered the enchiladas suizas which were also great. But definitely will order the birra tacos next time and he can order something else. 
I was incredibly impressed overall, the bar was clean, music wasn't too loud, AND they had the eagles game on. 
When we finally decided to leave and call it a night we agreed we'd be back weekly. Definitely one of our new favorites!

I've been wanting to check this place out for awhile now, and once I did, I have to say, it's one of my new favorites. I absolutely loved their margaritas! They're so fresh and made with fresh lime juice. The spicy margarita with the spicy rim was definitely my favorite. We also got the build your own guac, and I can't stop thinking about it. I can't wait to come back, a most stop in Philly!

Maybe because it was the last night of Restaurant Week, and they were slammed with customers...maybe it was because the kitchen just had an off night and simply "got in weeds"...whatever the case may be, this was the longest I have ever waited for a meal in Philadelphia. We were in this place for over 2 hours! And we weren't the only ones that felt the drag. The table next to us joked about the staff taking siestas between serving their courses.

But the staff was friendly enough. The constant apologies let us know that they were well aware of everything taking way longer than it should. But usually, at a well-managed establishment, once you hit the hour and half to two hour mark, someone stops by the table and offers to take a drink or appetizer off of your tab.

Yeah, this didn't happen.

And now we get to the food...

FIRST COURSE
My date's tortilla soup appetizer was actually kind of delicious. My salad appetizer...not so much.

SECOND COURSE
My date's camarones (shrimp) dish was okay. My sopacitos was pretty good.

THIRD COURSE
My date's steak & chorizo tacos were super-dry, but the crispy onions gave them an interesting, flavorful crunch. My seafood enchiladas were pretty decent.
 
So, the food was okay -- nothing to write home about, but nothing terrible...until the desserts came out...

FOURTH COURSE
My date's flan was okay, but a bit too creamy for flan, like the custard hadn't properly set. But my chocolate tres leches cake was an ABOMINATION! It literally tasted like ground dog biscuits soaked in chocolate milk! Not even kidding! Who let this DISGUSTING dessert out of the kitchen?!?! When I sent it back, our server wasn't surprised in the least bit, mentioning something about "the texture." Yes, I've had tres leches cake before and know that it's basically milk-soaked cake, but the crumb of this cake wasn't even like cake (see "ground dog biscuits" comment above)! So yeah, the texture, the flavor, and everything else -- everything about this dessert was completely off! Guys, do yourselves a solid and take this off the menu tonight!

And here's the kicker...when the server returned with the second flan to replace the tres leches abomination, it was totally different in texture from the first one that my date received. In fact, my flan was the exact opposite of hers: dense, chunky, and obviously somewhat overcooked. So much for consistency!

I might have given this place 3 stars if I wasn't in there from 8:30 to 11:00 trying to get a meal, but so much for that, too. Sorry, but there really is no point in coming back.

Tortilla Soup: 5/5
Salad: 1/5
Camarones (Shrimp): 3/5
Sopacitos: 4/5
Steak & Chorizo Tacos: 2/5
Seafood Enchiladas: 3/5
Vanilla Flan #1: 3/5
Vanilla Flan #2: 2/5
Chocolate Tres Leches Cake: 0/5

Very good bar scene for drinks and apps.  The guac is one of the best i have had anywhere including Mexico.  The fresh margaritas are among the best in the city.  We also enjoyed the flat bread.  The crowd tends to be very friendly and we met other couples who are a pleasure to speak with.  I recommend it for drinks and apps.

Xochitl is under new management, I was pleasantly surprised to find that they dropped me a quick note to invite us back.  I really appreciate that the management took the time out to take their patron's experiences to heart and improve on the overall dining experience.  I will definately stop in the next time I am in the neighborhood. A simple gesture goes a long way!

Very covid friendly - with the warm weather, they have tables scattered throughout S 2nd Street (which is blocked off from traffic)! Music playing in the background and an amazing spot during sunset!
Wide menu selection and food arrived at a decent time; however, was disappointed that they ran out if yucca fries and lemons - strange considering they're both common items. Appetizers were amazing, love the signature guacamole, ceviche and BLT (special)! Entree wasn't great though, short ribs in the tacos were dry and the seafood enchiladas' sauce was too sour and couldn't taste any seafood in the filling. 
All in all, highly recommend for drinks and light bites, not too much for the full meal.

This place is amazing.

Don't expect burritos and tacos here, however.  This isn't your average Americanized Mexican food.  It's authentic and delicious, and the drinks are fabulous as well.  

We had the Queso Fundido, which is deliciousness consisting of melted Chihuahua cheese and it comes with flour tortillas.  I had the Filete de Puerco al Tamarindo y Chipotle, which had the perfect amount of spicyness and rich flavors that blended so well together.  My cousins shared the Parrillada for two, which consists of a mixed grill of steak, shrimp, chicken, morcilla, duck and melted Chihuahua cheese, and they absolutely loved it.  

Xochitl has a happy hour as well, Tuesday-Sunday, 5-7 pm.  Since it's on the pricey side, if you're looking for a less expensive drink I would recommend going then.  

It's a small place and it can be hard to get a table there.  I would definitely recommend having a reservation.
I'm not a huge fan of Mexican but loved this place -- nothing gloppy or cliched here. Shrimp tacos were so fresh and set off perfectly with an apple-cabbage slaw. Recommend.

Popped in for a beer before taking a dance class across the street. Cool vibes, nice and attentive staff. They squeezed a lime into my Corona for me instead of giving me a slice of lime on the rim, and it was delicious. Enjoyable little spot.

I was fairly excited about going to this place, specifically because I finally figured out how to say the name instead of referring to it as that restaurant that starts with an X near south st. Sadly, I was disappointed. 

There were some highlights. My boyfriend and I walked in and was greeted by a very nice and friendly manager who even assisted us in choosing drinks that ended up being great. Their sangria specifically was fantastic. We then moved onto the guac which we created ourselves with assistance. Holy crap. Avocados, crab, onions, roasted garlic, black truffle and jalapeno. It sounds like way too much but holy crap is was amazing. If our meal ended right here, I would give this place 4 stars for sure. Sadly, it did not. 

The short rib tamale was delicious but barely resembled a tamale. The pork carnitas tacos were a bit dry and pale in comparison to my favorite ones at Cantina and the Pollo Fritta was just awful. I swear I can still feel that flavorless dry fried chicken sitting in my stomach 16 hours later. UGH. 

To sum it up, if I'm in the neighborhood, I would definitely have that guac and sangria at the bar but I will never sit down for a whole meal of food again.

The menu was great and the drinks are good.  Just like many places in Philly the drinks don't come from a mix.  However, they used bottom of the barrel Tequila to make the hand made Margaritas.  Don't get me wrong on the taste of the drink...they were great and I had 3.  However, I expected a little more.  When the food came (I had the salmon) it was WONDERFUL but the people I was eating with said theirs was cold...which was true.  I think the cooks prepared 2 meals forgetting mine and cooked it.

I will go back.   I liked the place but their system is a  little flawed.

Meh. Just, meh. It's pretty over-rated for dinner for the price you're paying. I will say the guacamole is amazing. Flavorful with a great texture. It's a nice touch that it is made table side in a traditional Mexican mortal & pestle. But why have the cook make us approve of every ingredient. I realize he was just trying to make it to our liking, but I'd rather have someone confident of the way its supposed to be made. We ordered a queso dip, pretty good. The ceviche is excellent! I remember last time I was there (a year ago) that there was more variety of ceviche. But the mackerel one we had was great. As were the two Sangria's I had. 

But entrees were just so-so. The brisket was excellent as was the celery root puree. But it was spicy-- in a more burning way, than a flavorful way. There wasn't much variety on the entree menu. My boyfriend ordered the head-on shrimp, which when removed were just small cocktail shrimp. It also consisted of the same ingredients in his appetizer. Partly his fault, but not much variety of flavors in their dishes. There were no other entrees on the menu that made me think 'oh, I'll come back to try that.'

So all in all- for appetizers and cocktails this is a fun place with a great atmosphere. For entrees and an amazing food experience take your dollars elsewhere.

The food was DELICIOUS!! Oh my gosh!! We got three different types of tacos, shrimp, chicken, and beef. We also get a side of chipotle mash fried plantains and chips guacamole (The peoples choice) and salsa. Their drinks are so good as well. I don't think you can go wrong with ordering anything from that menu.

The service however was one of the worst things I've ever experienced. We had three different waitresses that took our orders three different times and we never got our chips and guacamole until the end because we had to remind them they were so on organized. One stars for the service. This is why I cannot give them a perfect score even though the food was perfection.

Xochitl is a really good spot to sit outside on a nice summer/fall night. It's right in Headhouse square, and it's so nice to sit on the sidewalk out there and enjoy dinner and a few drinks. It was easy to make a reservation last minute for 5 people on a Saturday night, and we got a table outside, so that's a big plus.

We were seated on time and our server was attentive. I loved the guac card that you could personalize too! The guac was good and the chips were solid- nothing out of the ordinary but not too salty (too much salt is no good for me). I ordered the chicken enchilada and really enjoyed it. It didn't taste heavy or fatty even though it had a good amount of sauce. The only thing I didn't love was my drink, but I got a basic gin cocktail and that's not their specialty so I didn't care much.

After tax and tip the bill was a bit pricier than I had expected, and I believe there are other places to get Mexican that are just as good and not as pricey. However, the service and location are great so Xochitl is somewhere I will likely return.

Awesome! Delicious, good service, great location and super cute. We sat outside on a table perched on the cobblestone sidewalk outside the restaurant. We started with the guacamole  which was fresh and delicious! The tortilla chips were very crispy. Very good! For my main course, I ordered the chicken mole and I have to honestly say, this was the best mole I've ever had! We had a magical evening here. Highly recommended!
